comments:
Build 20020321

I copied the following extensions from the org.eclipse.jdt.launching plugin to 
my own plugin:

<extension
      point="org.eclipse.debug.core.launchConfigurationTypes">
   <launchConfigurationType
         name="%remoteJavaApplication"
         modes="debug"
         id="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.remoteJavaApplication"
         
delegate="org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaRemoteApplicationLaunchConfigu
rationDelegate">
      <fileExtension
            extension="java"
            default="false">
      </fileExtension>
      <fileExtension
            extension="class"
            default="false">
      </fileExtension>
   </launchConfigurationType>
</extension>

I then selected the 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaRemoteApplicationLaunchConfigurationDele
gate extension and tried to edit its 'delegate' property in the Properties 
view.  The following exception occurred:

java.lang.NullPointerException

I assume you used 'GUI' clipboard operations, not source.
Yes, I used the GUI operations.

It looks like the model reference was not copied for all objects, so 'editable 
model' test was performed on a NULL. Will examine.

This happened to me again.  It seems that the only way to workaround it is to 
exit Eclipse and restart the workspace.

Model-based clipboard support in manifest editors (non-source pages) is still 
somewhat fragile. If it hampers your productivity, I suggest doing copy/paste 
operations between Source pages until we fix the problem.

We are also looking for suggestions how to make GUI pages more powerful and 
useful so that you never need to go to Source (obviously, fixing this defect 
would be one of them :-).

Fixed - when objects from another editor are copied, they undergo serialization 
and reconstruction at the other end. Fields that are marked transient are not 
reconstructed. We had a correct code to recompute these fields on arrival for 
elements, but missed some fields for attributes. I was copying and pasting 
extensions from editors for a while, and everything seems to work now.
